questions.question: 1. Osteoma is defined as.....
options: Bone disease characterized by deficient matrix formation due to inadequate osteoblastic activity
A congenital disease characterized by overgrowth of fibrous tissue inside the bone. It occurs in children and adults
A group of diseases characterized by abnormality in the growth, formation, or structure of bone

questions.question: 2. Exostosis is a....
options: Rare disease of old males affecting the skull, vertebrae, pelvis, and long bones
A skeletal disorder resulting in a loss of bone mass
A benign tumor arising from the epiphyseal cartilage of growing long bones

6. Ewing's tumor is:
options: A bone disease characterized by deficient matrix formation due to inadequate osteoblastic activity
A tumor of unknown origin occurring in males between 10 and 25 years

questions.question: 7. Ewing's tumor shows the following morphology except:
options: Gray firm mass in the bone marrow with areas of hemorrhage and necrosis
Lifting of the periosteum with new bone formation (onion skin appearance on X-ray)
Multiple giant cells with more than 100 nuclei
Uniform small round cells with indefinite borders, scanty cytoplasm, and large rounded darkly stained nuclei

questions.question: 9. Features of osteosarcoma are:
options: The tumor arises mostly in relation to the endosteum, growing in the medullary canal and through the cortex forming a fusiform mass
Shows a sun ray appearance on X-ray
Microscopic picture shows spindle and polygonal malignant cells with many multinucleated malignant giant cells
